thread.title: Delhi-NCR cold wave alert: IMD says temperature might plunge below 4°C
thread.title_full: Delhi-NCR cold wave alert: IMD says temperature might plunge below 4°C

author: @CNBCTV18Live
title: Delhi-NCR cold wave alert: IMD says temperature might plunge below 4°C
text:
2 Min Read
The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert warning for the Delhi-NCR region for two consecutive days. Due to snowfall in the mountains, the temperature might drop below 4 degrees Celcius, the weather forecast shows.
This winter season Delhi has broken its 14-year record of lowest temperature. On December 11, Wednesday, the region woke up to temperature plunging below 5 degrees Celcius for the first time since 2009. For this year so far the lowest temperature recorded in Delhi has been 4.9 degrees Celcius.
As per archival sources, the lowest temperature ever recorded in Delhi was 0 degrees Celcius in the year 1930.
When the temperature of an area falls way below the average temperature, usually a difference of 4.5-6.4 degrees Celcius, then the region is said to be experiencing a cold wave.
For Delhi, the IMD predicts that the cold wave will last until December 16. A slight warming up after mid-December is expected.

This winter season Delhi has broken its 14-year record of lowest temperature. On December 11, Wednesday, the region woke up to temperature plunging below 5 degrees Celcius for the first time since 2009. For this year so far the lowest temperature recorded in Delhi has been 4.9 degrees Celcius.
[IMD](https://www.cnbctv18.com/india/imd-forecasts-very-heavy-rain-in-gangetic-west-bengal-till-august-20-19461395.htm)has forecasted that the temperatures are expected to remain low. They have also warned of cold waves in the region with the temperatures continuing to be at a low of 4-6 degrees Celcius.As per archival sources, the lowest temperature ever recorded in Delhi was 0 degrees Celcius in the year 1930.
When the temperature of an area falls way below the average temperature, usually a difference of 4.5-6.4 degrees Celcius, then the region is said to be experiencing a cold wave.
For Delhi, the IMD predicts that the cold wave will last until December 16. A slight warming up after mid-December is expected.
Apart from
[Delhi](https://www.cnbctv18.com/india/delhi-schools-receive-bomb-threat-mail-second-time-in-a-week-19523626.htm), IMD has forecasted cold waves for several regions in north India and some parts of western India. Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Chandigarh, Uttar Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat are the other places that have been warned of cold waves.Also Read:
